property.name: text
property.value:
This model draws fuel at a constant rate from Tank1. When the level in Tank1 gets below 1/4 of its capacity, the model begins transferring fuel from Tank2 to Tank1 (while it continues to draw fuel from Tank1 at a constant rate).
This is complicated by the fact that the physics does not allow an empty tank to provide fuel nor a full tank to accept it. The actual rate of fuel flow, therefore, is a consensus among the two tanks.

property.name: text
property.value:
Definition of the tank as a class facilitates model maintenance. It is defined in one place and instantiated in multiple places.
[see Lee, Liu, and Neuendorffer, Classes and inheritance in actor-oriented design, TECS 8(4), 2009]

property.name: text
property.value:
Model of a tank whose inputs are desired flow rates (in and out) and actual output flow rate, and the outputs are the actual input flow rate and the available output flow rate. The desired, available, and actual flow rates differ when the tank is full or empty. This architecture facilitates connecting one tank to another and having them collaborate on the actual flow.
When the tank becomes full, this model limits the inflow rate to be no greater than the outflow rate. When the tank becomes empty, this model limits the outflow rate to be no greater than the inflow rate.
Look inside the ModalModel to see how the limiting is accomplished. Effectively, we have three slightly different models when the tank is full, empty, and neither full nor empty.

property.name: text
property.value: This SetVariable actor makes the current tank level available as a parameter that can be referenced in the icon, which enables the animation of the level.

property.name: text
property.value: When the tank is neither full nor empty, the net flow is equal to the desiredInFlow minus the desiredOutFlow.

property.name: text
property.value: When the tank is full, the net flow is equal to the desiredOutFlow minus the minimum of the desiredOutFlow and the desiredInFlow, which in this mode is normally zero. The actualInFlow is equal to the minimum of the desiredOutFlow and the desiredInFlow.

property.name: text
property.value: When the tank is empty, the actual flow is equal to the desiredInFlow minus the minimum of the desiredInFlow and the desiredOutFlow. In this mode, it is always zero, so we just output zero. The actualOutFlow is equal to the minimum of the desiredOutFlow and the desiredInFlow.
